#challenge 2 - Linear regression model 

```{r}
#call functions and import data
library(curl)
library(ggplot2)
d <- curl('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/fuzzyatelin/fuzzyatelin.github.io/master/AN588_Fall21/KamilarAndCooperData.csv')
info <- read.csv(d, stringsAsFactors = FALSE, header = TRUE)
head(data)
```

```{r}
#regular model (no log)
#use lm function to find values
y <- data$MaxLongevity_m
x <- data$Brain_Size_Species_Mean
w <- lm(y ~ x, data=info)
summary(w)
#make a function to use in geom_test label 
lm_eqn <- function(w) {
a = format(coef(w)[1], digits = 3)
b = format(abs(coef(w)[2]), digits = 3)
  if (coef(w)[2] >= 0)  {
    eq <- paste('y','=', a, '+', b, 'x')
  } else {
    eq <- paste('y','=', a, '-', b, 'x') 
eq
  }
}
#run ggplot
gg <- ggplot(data = info, aes(x = x, y = y)) + geom_point() + geom_text(x = 500, y = 800,label= lm_eqn(w)) + geom_smooth(method = "lm", formula = y ~ x)
gg
```
